analyzed: sabba dhammānam tathatā asaṅkha tā ati
translated: “Is the suchness of all ideas unformed?”

analyzed: sabba dhammānam tathatā asaṅkhatā nibbānam asaṅkhatanti
translated: “Is the suchness of all ideas unformed and is Nibbāna unformed?”

analyzed: rūpassa rūpa tā nanu rūpa tā asaṅkhatā ati

original: rūpassa rūpatā, nanu rūpatā asaṅkhatā, nibbānaṁ asaṅkhatanti?
analyzed: rūpassa rūpa tā nanu rūpa tā asaṅkhatā nibbānam asaṅkhatanti
translated: “Is the materiality of materiality unformed and is Nibbāna unformed?”

analyzed: vedanāya vedana tā nanu vedana tā pe
saññāya sañña tā nanu sañña tā pe
translated: Is perception the nature of perception? …
Are volitional formations the nature of volitional formations? …

analyzed: viññāṇassa viññāṇa tā nanu viññāṇa tā asaṅkhatā ati
translated: Is consciousness the nature of consciousness? Is the nature of consciousness unconditioned?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

analyzed: rūpassa rūpa tā nanu rūpa tā pe

original: viññāṇassa viññāṇatā, nanu viññāṇatā asaṅkhatā, nibbānaṁ asaṅkhatanti?
analyzed: viññāṇassa viññāṇa tā nanu viññāṇa tā asaṅkhatā nibbānam asaṅkhatanti
translated: Is the nature of consciousness unconditioned? Is Nibbāna unconditioned?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Yes.”🔽“Are there six shelters, six places of safety, six retreats, six destinations, six kinds of destinations, six kinds of abodes of beings, and six kinds of realms of beings?”🔽“No.”

“Are there six unconditioned things?”🔽“Yes.”🔽“Are there six shelters, six places of safety, six retreats, six destinations, six kinds of destinations, six kinds of abodes of beings, and six kinds of realms of beings?”

analyzed: sabba dhammānam tathatā asaṅkha tā ati
translated: “Is the suchness of all dhammas unconditioned?”
“Is the suchness of all dhammas form …🔽feeling …
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”

analyzed: tena hi sabba dhammānam tathatā asaṅkhatā ati
translated: “Then the suchness of all dhammas is unconditioned.”
The Discussion of Suchness is finished.
